channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: In a remarkably direct appeal by a wartime leader to policymakers in Washington, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine made an urgent and emotional appeal to Congress on Wednesday to come to his country’s aid as it fights off a brutal Russian invasion. https://t.co/UfansM4uCs https://t.co/UN8NDvl2ym

More than 75 years after 400 Dutch Jews disappeared in a Nazi roundup that presaged the Holocaust, a historian set out to learn what happened to each and every one of them. She succeeded. https://t.co/GcZRNgEfBf

A Russian-owned superyacht is stranded in Norway because local oil suppliers refuse to refuel the ship.
The yacht is owned by the Russian oligarch Vladimir Strzhalkovsky, a former KGB agent and longtime associate of President Vladimir Putin. https://t.co/E4ObmdHJXp https://t.co/FgN49MvVY0
Breaking News: A powerful 7.3-magnitude earthquake struck near Fukushima in Japan, a region battered by a tsunami 11 years ago. Follow live updates. https://t.co/ACO1uwt8Lo

“To be the leader of the world means to be the leader of peace,” President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said, as members of Congress grew visibly emotional. Lawmakers sat rapt in their seats. Some scribbled notes and many sniffled back tears. https://t.co/rLSGaR3o3S

Breaking News: President Volodomyr Zelensky of Ukraine made an urgent and emotional appeal for help in a speech to Congress and showed searing footage of civilian casualties. https://t.co/SdC81Xstqn https://t.co/GLdMR3TScH
The Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv is being shelled every day. Bodies are piled at the morgue. But residents refuse to succumb. https://t.co/vgIziYXQPm https://t.co/RdEQP9JlJ4

The administration of former Gov. Andrew Cuomo failed to publicly account for the deaths of about 4,100 nursing home residents in New York during the pandemic, according to an audit released on Tuesday by the state comptroller. https://t.co/IQhLcInM2f

In a daring show of support for Ukraine, leaders of three eastern members of the European Union — Czechia, Poland and Slovenia — traveled to Kyiv on a mission that was kept secret until after they had boarded a train to the embattled Ukrainian capital.
https://t.co/48Vvzqp90P

The Council of Europe, the continent’s main institution governing human rights, voted to expel Russia as a member. The decision came hours after Russia had given formal notice that it would withdraw from the group. https://t.co/LdwfYozcY1 https://t.co/4iZzh3GgcT

A Russian-owned superyacht is stranded in Norway because local oil suppliers refuse to refuel the ship.
The yacht is owned by the Russian oligarch Vladimir Strzhalkovsky, a former KGB agent and longtime associate of President Vladimir Putin. https://t.co/0rsSijncJ2
The Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv is being shelled every day. Bodies are piled at the morgue. But residents refuse to succumb. https://t.co/QexQVHqA1K https://t.co/dJWhBCE1fj

President Volodymyr Zelensky thanked three NATO-member country leaders who traveled to Ukraine for an extraordinary meeting.
“I am sure that with such friends, with such countries, with such neighbors and partners, we will really be able to win,” he said.https://t.co/D9iugEXS2c
The skating won’t stop when the ice melts at Rockefeller Center. A roller rink is opening at the complex for the first time since 1940. 🛼 https://t.co/l8v46MUr5o

Zelensky was making an argument about nationhood — that it is formed not by history or by language, but by memories and personal connections. “Note,” he continued, “that I’m speaking now in Russian, but no one in Russia understands what I’m talking about.” https://t.co/r21OGYVu7W

Ukrainian officials plan to present the U.S. with a list of military equipment they need, including armed drones and mobile air-defense systems, when President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine addresses Congress on Wednesday. https://t.co/NoWN4UApiz

A Russian state television employee who stormed a live broadcast Monday has been fined by a Moscow court for saying in a video that she was “deeply ashamed” to have helped make “Kremlin propaganda." She still faces a prison sentence over the protest. https://t.co/fFmgkyvmP6 https://t.co/wb2FanGFsa
The Ukrainian city of Mykolaiv is being shelled every day. Bodies are piled at the morgue. But residents refuse to succumb. https://t.co/XfIjEDRnJx https://t.co/JpoBXN5GXm

Francis Kéré has won the Pritzker Prize, architecture’s highest honor. His use of indigenous materials and local symbols to lift up the West African community he came from helped earn him the prize, the jury said. https://t.co/BlBfgDpgzE

Japan, one of the world’s least friendly countries to refugees, has admitted dozens of Ukrainians who have fled the Russian invasion, officials said. Those who have family or friends already in Japan will be granted a temporary 90-day visa. https://t.co/bDqg1ZahHD

A Russian state television employee who stormed a live broadcast Monday has been fined by a Moscow court for saying in a video that she was “deeply ashamed” to have helped make “Kremlin propaganda." She still faces a prison sentence over the protest. https://t.co/5Db9fx2HkO

The Senate on Tuesday voted to make Daylight Saving Time permanent. The bill, if made law, would take effect in November 2023, freeing Americans from the biannual ritual of changing clocks. https://t.co/LVF8mmYXk2 https://t.co/8ChOoQtP7o

Brother and sister, Dmytro, 10, and Viktoriia, 8, are among the millions who fled Ukraine. Last week, they arrived for their first day of school in Italy, and students greeted them with tiny Ukrainian and Italian flags they made in classrooms a day prior. https://t.co/2oA7gPH4fF https://t.co/lUr4lJWzmf

In an emotional address to Canada’s Parliament, President Volodymyr Zelensky urged its members to support a no-fly zone over Ukraine, asking them to imagine cities like Vancouver or Toronto being attacked, and calling for intensifying sanctions on Russia. https://t.co/GCkyJMC85E

Papa John’s International said last week that it was suspending all of its corporate operations in Russia, following in the footsteps of other high-profile American brands. But an American who oversees 190 franchises there is keeping them open. https://t.co/HOpQFG8xs4
President Biden will travel to Brussels next week to attend an extraordinary NATO meeting over the war in Ukraine. https://t.co/CDJKoAl7mK
The ballistic missiles that Russia has fired into Ukraine contain a surprise, U.S. officials discovered: previously unknown decoys designed to evade air-defense systems. https://t.co/I9VKdObcMW

Some House Democrats called for an investigation into the postmaster general's decision to buy up to 165,000 gas-powered mail trucks instead of electric over the Biden administration's objections that the contract would undermine the U.S.’s climate goals. https://t.co/zmA7xje5ZV

Breaking News: Pierre Zakrzewski, a Fox News cameraman, was killed on Monday in Ukraine when his vehicle came under fire outside of Kyiv, the network said. He was traveling in the same vehicle as Benjamin Hall, a correspondent also injured in the attack. https://t.co/O6BIrxDORf

France could offer diplomatic “protection” to Marina Ovsyannikova, the Russian state television employee who was detained after an on-air antiwar protest, President Emmanuel Macron said. https://t.co/bsjKcsEg0U
The Fox News correspondent Benjamin Hall was injured on Monday in Ukraine while reporting outside of Kyiv and has been hospitalized, the network said. https://t.co/inxTS1S61C

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine urged Russian troops to surrender.
“I give you a chance,” he said. “If you surrender to our forces, we will treat you the way people are supposed to be treated — as people, decently.” https://t.co/eciyOI7ook

Anna Sorokin, the swindler whose fictionalized story was the subject of the Netflix show “Inventing Anna,” will be deported to Germany after she was detained by U.S. immigration authorities for overstaying her visa. https://t.co/gOByFNTKty

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine stepped up his appeals to Russian soldiers and citizens appalled by the war, calling on them to fight to end the conflict.
“You must not lose your chance,” Zelensky said, speaking in Russian. https://t.co/6fjKpkLf72

President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine sent condolences to the family of Brent Renaud, the U.S. journalist who was killed outside Kyiv, thanking the filmmaker for his commitment to documenting the war. https://t.co/NNtvrEU8PE https://t.co/j3YAAW4V80

Breaking News: The leaders of Poland, Slovenia and the Czech Republic said they would meet in Kyiv to express the EU’s “unequivocal support” for Ukraine and offer financial help. https://t.co/QzbSJ9fqvX

Wang Jixian, a Chinese computer programmer living in Ukraine, has become one of the boldest voices challenging China’s skewed and euphemistic depiction of the war. His video dispatches are drawing hundreds of thousands of viewers. https://t.co/7lgVQGbe5v https://t.co/aZyGJkN1SK

After crossing into Moldova from Ukraine, a Ukrainian refugee stared at her country’s side of the border as she waited for relatives to cross and join her.
Live updates: https://t.co/swiRXtnlLG https://t.co/eVbxmYcM1R

Marina Ovsyannikova, an employee of Russia's state-run Channel 1, burst onto the live broadcast of the network's most-watched news show on Monday evening, yelling "Stop the war!" and holding up a sign that said "They’re lying to you here." https://t.co/HrOhKhPjXu

Breaking News: A court in southern India upheld a state ban on hijabs in schools, saying they are not an essential part of religious practice under Islam. The ruling is likely to heighten tensions at a time when India is increasingly polarized. https://t.co/AKfsbSG0hj

China’s top diplomat called on the international community to support peace talks between Russia and Ukraine “to help de-escalate the situation as soon as possible,” according to a statement. https://t.co/6cDsdDVfkt

Protesters on Sunday broke into a London mansion that is one of the addresses of Oleg Deripaska, the Russian oligarch known for being close to Vladimir Putin. “You occupy Ukraine, we occupy you,” a flyer from the self-described anarchists read. https://t.co/md0j6cq0Qd https://t.co/6qi3CtVrlS

The mood is tense in Lithuania, one of the three small Baltic States and NATO members that spent half of the 20th century under Soviet rule. Many there worry that if Ukraine falls, they might be next. https://t.co/dRxAPgeS2r

A man was charged with attempted murder as a hate crime after he assaulted a woman of Asian descent in Yonkers, New York, on Friday. The assault, which was captured by a security camera, marks another incident in a nationwide surge of anti-Asian violence. https://t.co/1KMSve7ALP

Pete Davidson will travel to the edge of space next week on the next Blue Origin spaceflight, the company said on Monday. The "Saturday Night Live" star will be one of six passengers on the company’s New Shepard rocket for its 20th flight. https://t.co/tHxQiD6oTX

Residents of a severely damaged apartment complex in Kyiv attempted to salvage belongings from their apartments after the attack on Monday. Despite peace talks, Russia launched a flurry of strikes on the Ukrainian capital.
Follow live updates: https://t.co/MPHPxPaHSg https://t.co/F2sjMDV3S2

A document found in the possession of Enrique Tarrio, the former head of the Proud Boys, contained a detailed plan to surveil and storm seven government buildings on Jan. 6, 2021. The plan closely resembled what actually unfolded at the Capitol. https://t.co/tA284dvUMS
Tens of thousands have fled Russia since the invasion of Ukraine, outraged about the war and seeing no future back home. https://t.co/15zXpixg52

A young man fleeing war in Sudan and a young woman evacuating Ukraine crossed into Poland at the same time. They had very different experiences. He said he was beaten and called racial slurs. She wakes up every day to a stocked fridge and fresh bread. https://t.co/oTNeWMi4Tv

Marina Ovsyannikova, an employee of Russia's state-run Channel 1, burst onto the live broadcast of the network's most-watched news show on Monday evening, yelling "Stop the war!" and holding up a sign that said "They’re lying to you here." https://t.co/4lLFtZ27Po
